bitmark:
[.book]
[@id:294320]
[@externalId:e-16-successful-strategies-to-sc_lne1r81qr0jp]
[#16 Successful Strategies to Scale your Business]
[@language:en]
[##Turn Leads into Customers]
[@coverImage:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/ebook_cover.png]
[@publisher:sensaletion]
[@theme:sensaletion_e_book]

bit.title: 16 Successful Strategies to Scale your Business
bit.subtitle: Turn Leads into Customers

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294321]
[▼ch-1]
[#Introduction]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294322]
Every entrepreneur wants to scale their business. Scaling your business means increasing your number of customers. To achieve that, you need to sell. In fact, whether you like it or not, **every entrepreneur is a sales person**. Because without sales, you won’t be an entrepreneur for long.

bit.body: Every entrepreneur wants to scale their business. Scaling your business means increasing your number of customers. To achieve that, you need to sell. In fact, whether you like it or not, **every entrepreneur is a sales person**. Because without sales, you won’t be an entrepreneur for long.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294323]
The conclusion therefore is rather simple: entrepreneurs need to be successful sellers.

bit.body: The conclusion therefore is rather simple: entrepreneurs need to be successful sellers.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294324]
Selling however isn't that easy. Successful sellers, whatever business’ involved in, have certain strategies that they rely upon for success.

bit.body: Selling however isn't that easy. Successful sellers, whatever business’ involved in, have certain strategies that they rely upon for success.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294325]
While there are many different strategies out there, some are so vitally important that applying them will significantly increase your chance of success in the selling process.

bit.body: While there are many different strategies out there, some are so vitally important that applying them will significantly increase your chance of success in the selling process.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294326]
**The 16 most successful sales strategies** are presented here. The more you adopt, the more the compounding effect of closing opportunities will grow accordingly.

bit.body: **The 16 most successful sales strategies** are presented here. The more you adopt, the more the compounding effect of closing opportunities will grow accordingly.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294327]
Let’s have a look at 16 strategies that are going to make you convert a lot more customers from your leads.

bit.body: Let’s have a look at 16 strategies that are going to make you convert a lot more customers from your leads.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294328]
[▼ch-2]
[#Every successful seller ...
Has a sales system]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Has a sales system

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294329]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_1.png][@width:1598]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294330]
Often underrated, is a **sales system**. However, a solid system is crucial for success in sales. It serves as a framework that includes all the steps of the selling process in chronological order. Each and every single step tells you what the repeatable process is to execute.

bit.body: Often underrated, is a **sales system**. However, a solid system is crucial for success in sales. It serves as a framework that includes all the steps of the selling process in chronological order. Each and every single step tells you what the repeatable process is to execute.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294331]
Every successful seller has a system that they rely upon, all the time. They don’t depend on their personality, customer, or mood to sell, but on the system, they use consistently throughout the process.

bit.body: Every successful seller has a system that they rely upon, all the time. They don’t depend on their personality, customer, or mood to sell, but on the system, they use consistently throughout the process.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294332]
A sales system works even better for people who are more introverted.

bit.body: A sales system works even better for people who are more introverted.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294333]
By relying on a system, they **know what to say** when making the process systematic. Unsuccessful sellers on the other hand do not utilize their system and suffer from inconsistent sales results as a consequence.

bit.body: By relying on a system, they **know what to say** when making the process systematic. Unsuccessful sellers on the other hand do not utilize their system and suffer from inconsistent sales results as a consequence.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294334]
As you want to **direct the customer** as well as make the customer feel comfortable, you need your process to be a smooth one.

bit.body: As you want to **direct the customer** as well as make the customer feel comfortable, you need your process to be a smooth one.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294335]
Luckily, it doesn’t have to be very complicated. Think of your selling process and **write it down step by step**. From there, assemble a basic structure that serves as your guideline to success. The better your system becomes, the less other external factors will matter.

bit.body: Luckily, it doesn’t have to be very complicated. Think of your selling process and **write it down step by step**. From there, assemble a basic structure that serves as your guideline to success. The better your system becomes, the less other external factors will matter.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294336]
Implementing a sales system is one of the highest income-producing activities you can do for your business!

bit.body: Implementing a sales system is one of the highest income-producing activities you can do for your business!

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294337]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_2.png][@width:724]

[.chapter]
[@id:294338]
[▼ch-3]
[#Every successful seller ...
Diagnoses instead of pitches]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Diagnoses instead of pitches

bitmark:
[.quote:bitmark--]
[@id:294339]
People love to buy, but don’t want to be sold to [@quotedPerson:Jeffrey Gitomer].

bit.body: People love to buy, but don’t want to be sold to .

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294340]
In fact, a client only wants to hear and see one person: herself. For those reasons, **never start a conversation with a pitch**. It has the opposite effect of what you want to achieve. It sets you up for failure.

bit.body: In fact, a client only wants to hear and see one person: herself. For those reasons, **never start a conversation with a pitch**. It has the opposite effect of what you want to achieve. It sets you up for failure.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294341]
Pitching yourself is making yourself a marketing brochure. The information that you would pitch should be on your website and as a matter of a fact, that’s why people contacted you in the first place. They know about your solution already.

bit.body: Pitching yourself is making yourself a marketing brochure. The information that you would pitch should be on your website and as a matter of a fact, that’s why people contacted you in the first place. They know about your solution already.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294342]
Instead of pitching, it is your job to uncover what the prospect truly is looking for. Why did they contact you? How can your product or service be the solution they need?

bit.body: Instead of pitching, it is your job to uncover what the prospect truly is looking for. Why did they contact you? How can your product or service be the solution they need?

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294343]
Furthermore, **the buying and selling process is one based on emotions**. Another reason why you should diagnose and not pitch.

bit.body: Furthermore, **the buying and selling process is one based on emotions**. Another reason why you should diagnose and not pitch.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294344]
People want to feel that you get them, including their emotional and logical problems. A pitch shows no empathy or relevance.

bit.body: People want to feel that you get them, including their emotional and logical problems. A pitch shows no empathy or relevance.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294345]
What you therefore should do instead is simple: **Diagnose**. Simply ask your prospect what the problem or desire is, what she’s looking for and how you might be able to help.

bit.body: What you therefore should do instead is simple: **Diagnose**. Simply ask your prospect what the problem or desire is, what she’s looking for and how you might be able to help.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294346]
**Diagnosing shows empathy** and helps you to understand the customer’s issues or wishes, making it relevant. From there, you can start advising.

bit.body: **Diagnosing shows empathy** and helps you to understand the customer’s issues or wishes, making it relevant. From there, you can start advising.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294347]
[▼ch-4]
[#Every successful seller ...
Sells based on intangible value]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Sells based on intangible value

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294348]
Do you know what you sell? Do you sell a product? Or a service? Perhaps an experience? All wrong!

bit.body: Do you know what you sell? Do you sell a product? Or a service? Perhaps an experience? All wrong!

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294349]
**You sell the benefit of that product, service, or experience**. It’s these benefits that solve your customer’s problems or wishes. Moreover, that benefit is intangible. While your product or service may be tangible, the true value that you deliver to your customers is intangible.

bit.body: **You sell the benefit of that product, service, or experience**. It’s these benefits that solve your customer’s problems or wishes. Moreover, that benefit is intangible. While your product or service may be tangible, the true value that you deliver to your customers is intangible.

bitmark:
[.example:bitmark--]
[@id:294350]
Let's look at a simple example: Real estate.

A real tangible product that you can touch. Now answer the following question:
Would you buy a house for the dirt and the structure itself or would you buy it for benefits such as location, usefulness, beauty, spaciousness, growth potential, view, and return on investment?

The latter is the intangible value.

bit.body:
Let's look at a simple example: Real estate.

A real tangible product that you can touch. Now answer the following question:
Would you buy a house for the dirt and the structure itself or would you buy it for benefits such as location, usefulness, beauty, spaciousness, growth potential, view, and return on investment?

The latter is the intangible value.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294351]
It’s that intangible value that you must sell to the customer for her to understand the true benefit!

bit.body: It’s that intangible value that you must sell to the customer for her to understand the true benefit!

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294352]
[▼ch-5]
[#Every successful seller ...
Establishes credibility]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294353]
Never assume that people know you. Even though a lead reaches out to you, it doesn’t mean that they know your professional background and your level of experience. Therefore, before you can even start diagnosing, your goal is to establish credibility.

bit.body: Never assume that people know you. Even though a lead reaches out to you, it doesn’t mean that they know your professional background and your level of experience. Therefore, before you can even start diagnosing, your goal is to establish credibility.
Credibility helps your selling process in multiple ways;

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294355]
it demonstrates your trustworthiness, your believability, and your perceived competence. It lets people know that **you can be trusted**.

bit.body: it demonstrates your trustworthiness, your believability, and your perceived competence. It lets people know that **you can be trusted**.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294356]
It proves to people that you would be a good person to work with.

bit.body: It proves to people that you would be a good person to work with.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294357]
In addition, credibility allows you to inform the customer what you are worth.

bit.body: In addition, credibility allows you to inform the customer what you are worth.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294358]
Credibility is **the basis for a good mutual relationship** and increases your chances of closing a deal.

bit.body: Credibility is **the basis for a good mutual relationship** and increases your chances of closing a deal.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294359]
Establishing your credibility can be done in numerous ways, of which one of which is by asking the right questions.

bit.body: Establishing your credibility can be done in numerous ways, of which one of which is by asking the right questions.

bitmark:
[.hint:bitmark++]
[@id:294671]
Want to know which questions to ask?
==LET'S GO==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|

bit.body:
Want to know which questions to ask?
==LET'S GO==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294360]
[▼ch-6]
[#Every successful seller ...
Works with the customer]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Works with the customer

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294361]
Making it a collaborative process, with **mutually beneficial outcomes**.

bit.body: Making it a collaborative process, with **mutually beneficial outcomes**.

bitmark:
[.quote:bitmark--]
[@id:294362]
Selling isn’t something you do to someone. It is something you do for someone and with someone [@quotedPerson:Anthony Iannarino].

bit.body: Selling isn’t something you do to someone. It is something you do for someone and with someone .

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294363]
People don’t want to be sold to. Successful salespeople, business owners, and entrepreneurs understand that **you need to work with a client** to make it work.

bit.body: People don’t want to be sold to. Successful salespeople, business owners, and entrepreneurs understand that **you need to work with a client** to make it work.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294364]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_3.png][@width:684]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294365]
By working with the client, you show your empathy and develop a relevant solution. Collaboration should lead to a mutually beneficial deal. The customer is happy with the end result, and you are happy with the deal. Meanwhile, you establish a long-term relationship.

bit.body: By working with the client, you show your empathy and develop a relevant solution. Collaboration should lead to a mutually beneficial deal. The customer is happy with the end result, and you are happy with the deal. Meanwhile, you establish a long-term relationship.

bitmark:
[.note:bitmark++]
[@id:294366]
No need to complicate it. Simply ask a few feedback questions

• How is this feeling for you?
• Is this what you're looking for?
• Anything else that you feel needs to be done?

bit.body:
No need to complicate it. Simply ask a few feedback questions

• How is this feeling for you?
• Is this what you're looking for?
• Anything else that you feel needs to be done?

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294367]
The received feedback allows you to adjust your solution and tailor it to the client’s needs.

bit.body: The received feedback allows you to adjust your solution and tailor it to the client’s needs.

bitmark:
[.hint:bitmark++]
[@id:294672]
Want to learn how to work together?
==I'M READY==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|

bit.body:
Want to learn how to work together?
==I'M READY==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294368]
[▼ch-7]
[#Every successful seller ...
Talks & acts assertively]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Talks & acts assertively

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294369]
Customers want to be directed and the way you talk and act makes a huge difference in this process.

bit.body: Customers want to be directed and the way you talk and act makes a huge difference in this process.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294370]
Imagine you walk into a store, looking for some shorts. Whom would you feel more comfortable with assisting you?

bit.body: Imagine you walk into a store, looking for some shorts. Whom would you feel more comfortable with assisting you?

bitmark:
[.message:bitmark--]
[@id:294371]
__Person A__: Someone who is insecure, looking down, talking quietly, and looking nervous.

__Person B__: Someone who puts the shoulders up, talks with confidence, looks you in the eye and uses assumptive words.

bit.body:
__Person A__: Someone who is insecure, looking down, talking quietly, and looking nervous.

__Person B__: Someone who puts the shoulders up, talks with confidence, looks you in the eye and uses assumptive words.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294372]
I bet it’s person B.

bit.body: I bet it’s person B.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294373]
And this makes a lot of sense. Sellers that demonstrate confidence and talk assertively have 50-70% of a prospect saying yes.

bit.body: And this makes a lot of sense. Sellers that demonstrate confidence and talk assertively have 50-70% of a prospect saying yes.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294374]
Those confident emotions are transferred to your prospect, reducing resistance. Conversely, nonassertive, insecure requests result in a 10-30% success rate.

bit.body: Those confident emotions are transferred to your prospect, reducing resistance. Conversely, nonassertive, insecure requests result in a 10-30% success rate.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294375]
**Conclusion**: Ask confidently and assertively.

bit.body: **Conclusion**: Ask confidently and assertively.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294376]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_4.png][@width:874]

[.chapter]
[@id:294377]
[▼ch-8]
[#Every successful seller ...
Knows his research]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Knows his research

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294378]
Every successful seller is seen as **the expert**. The expert that customers can rely upon. Therefore, knowing your own product inside out isn’t enough.

bit.body: Every successful seller is seen as **the expert**. The expert that customers can rely upon. Therefore, knowing your own product inside out isn’t enough.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294379]
To become your client’s trusted advisor, you need to know everything there is to know.

bit.body: To become your client’s trusted advisor, you need to know everything there is to know.

bitmark:
[.note:bitmark++]
[@id:294380]
Do your research in three-fold to Wow your prospect:

•1 Customer research
•1 Competitor research
•1 Market/Industry research

bit.body:
Do your research in three-fold to Wow your prospect:

•1 Customer research
•1 Competitor research
•1 Market/Industry research

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294381]
By knowing your market, you can answer all potential questions.

bit.body: By knowing your market, you can answer all potential questions.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294382]
Moreover, you want to **stand out**. You want to differentiate yourself. That’s why market knowledge is as important as product knowledge. Use your acquired knowledge to apply that to your offer so that you deliver something unique and valuable. What’s innovative, unique, or unusual? Standing out may very well have the biggest impact on your sales.

bit.body: Moreover, you want to **stand out**. You want to differentiate yourself. That’s why market knowledge is as important as product knowledge. Use your acquired knowledge to apply that to your offer so that you deliver something unique and valuable. What’s innovative, unique, or unusual? Standing out may very well have the biggest impact on your sales.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294383]
Furthermore, nothing is more awkward than being confronted with questions about your competitors. And countering arguments is only possible if you actually know what your competitors offer.

bit.body: Furthermore, nothing is more awkward than being confronted with questions about your competitors. And countering arguments is only possible if you actually know what your competitors offer.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294384]
**Do your research** to ensure you know all there is to know about the industry. Only then you can be the authority you desire to be.

bit.body: **Do your research** to ensure you know all there is to know about the industry. Only then you can be the authority you desire to be.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294385]
[▼ch-9]
[#Every successful seller ...
Has a pipeline lined up]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Has a pipeline lined up

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294386]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_5.png][@width:1598]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294387]
No pipeline = No success.

bit.body: No pipeline = No success.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294388]
**You will never convert 100% of the deals**. To ensure you have a healthy business, you always need to have several new potential deals lined up.

bit.body: **You will never convert 100% of the deals**. To ensure you have a healthy business, you always need to have several new potential deals lined up.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294389]
While any marketing strategy might be responsible for filling your pipeline from the top, if you don’t take action, if you don’t follow up accordingly, marketing is money straight down the drain.

bit.body: While any marketing strategy might be responsible for filling your pipeline from the top, if you don’t take action, if you don’t follow up accordingly, marketing is money straight down the drain.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294390]
The great thing about having a pipeline is that you can go into meetings much more relaxed. Being relaxed also enables you to talk and act assertively. Which, as we know, highly increases your chance for success.

bit.body: The great thing about having a pipeline is that you can go into meetings much more relaxed. Being relaxed also enables you to talk and act assertively. Which, as we know, highly increases your chance for success.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294391]
In addition, **a pipeline allows you to forecast**. Forecasting is important to know if you still make ends meet.

bit.body: In addition, **a pipeline allows you to forecast**. Forecasting is important to know if you still make ends meet.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294392]
[▼ch-10]
[#Every successful seller ...
Makes eye contact]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Makes eye contact

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294393]
The importance of eye contact cannot be emphasized enough.

bit.body: The importance of eye contact cannot be emphasized enough.

bitmark:
[.quote:bitmark--]
[@id:294394]
"The eyes are the windows to the soul" [@quotedPerson:David Ludden].

bit.body: "The eyes are the windows to the soul" .

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294395]
Eye contact provides us with information about someone’s mood, truthfulness, and approachability. **Direct eye contact is a sign of confidence** and builds trust consequently.

bit.body: Eye contact provides us with information about someone’s mood, truthfulness, and approachability. **Direct eye contact is a sign of confidence** and builds trust consequently.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294396]
We already learned that buying and selling is an emotional process. Well, eyes connect humans at an emotional level like nothing else.

bit.body: We already learned that buying and selling is an emotional process. Well, eyes connect humans at an emotional level like nothing else.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294397]
On the flip side, no eye contact looks as if you are insecure, lying, or uncaring.

bit.body: On the flip side, no eye contact looks as if you are insecure, lying, or uncaring.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294398]
To summarize, it’s simple: You need to make eye contact. Period.

bit.body: To summarize, it’s simple: You need to make eye contact. Period.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:294399]
Do you struggle with making direct eye contact? Follow the ==Sensaletion E-Academy==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy| to learn how to make intentional eye contact and receive practical exercises!

bit.body: Do you struggle with making direct eye contact? Follow the ==Sensaletion E-Academy==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy| to learn how to make intentional eye contact and receive practical exercises!

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294400]
[▼ch-11]
[#Every successful seller ...
Smiles]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294401]
Similar to eye contact, smiling is vitally important. **A smile is universal**.

bit.body: Similar to eye contact, smiling is vitally important. **A smile is universal**.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294402]
It’s a communication tool that binds people. It, therefore, is a powerful and effective facial expression. On top of that, a smile puts customers at ease, creating a relaxed environment and humanizing a business meeting.

bit.body: It’s a communication tool that binds people. It, therefore, is a powerful and effective facial expression. On top of that, a smile puts customers at ease, creating a relaxed environment and humanizing a business meeting.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294403]
The after-effect is pretty great as well. **Prospects are more willing to engage** and develop relationships.

bit.body: The after-effect is pretty great as well. **Prospects are more willing to engage** and develop relationships.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294404]
**Tip**: While on the phone - smile! People can sense a sincere smile through the phone. It creates a positive vibe.

bit.body: **Tip**: While on the phone - smile! People can sense a sincere smile through the phone. It creates a positive vibe.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294405]
Just smile and people will smile back at you.

bit.body: Just smile and people will smile back at you.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294406]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_6.png][@width:1242]

[.chapter]
[@id:294407]
[▼ch-12]
[#Every successful seller ...
Gains micro-commitments]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294408]
No micro-commitments means not sealing the deal. **A micro-commitment effectively is gaining the customer’s engagement throughout the process**. You need that engagement to convert a lead into a customer.

bit.body: No micro-commitments means not sealing the deal. **A micro-commitment effectively is gaining the customer’s engagement throughout the process**. You need that engagement to convert a lead into a customer.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294409]
You win engagement at the end of every step in your sales process. The key is to never leave a conversation without a firm next step. Vague statements such as “I’ll call you next week” are terrible and set you up for failure.

bit.body: You win engagement at the end of every step in your sales process. The key is to never leave a conversation without a firm next step. Vague statements such as “I’ll call you next week” are terrible and set you up for failure.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294410]
You need to direct the customer and **secure a committed next step**. Such a step requires action from you and the prospect. Also, you need to set a date as soon as possible.

bit.body: You need to direct the customer and **secure a committed next step**. Such a step requires action from you and the prospect. Also, you need to set a date as soon as possible.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294411]
Winning the commitment leverages the investment effect of time, money, effort, and emotion. It moves you from momentum to momentum.

bit.body: Winning the commitment leverages the investment effect of time, money, effort, and emotion. It moves you from momentum to momentum.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:294412]
There are several tactics to implement micro-commitments. Learn more about these tactics in the ==Sensaletion E-Academy==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|.

bit.body: There are several tactics to implement micro-commitments. Learn more about these tactics in the ==Sensaletion E-Academy==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294413]
[▼ch-13]
[#Every successful seller ...
Understand emotions]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294414]
As we already know - people make decisions based on emotions first, before they justify them with logic. In other words, they feel, then they think. Emotions, therefore, play a huge role in the buying and selling process.

bit.body: As we already know - people make decisions based on emotions first, before they justify them with logic. In other words, they feel, then they think. Emotions, therefore, play a huge role in the buying and selling process.

bitmark:
[.note:bitmark++]
[@id:294415]
Consequently, emotions are to be understood in 2 days.

•1 The Buyer emotions
•1 The Seller emotions

bit.body:
Consequently, emotions are to be understood in 2 days.

•1 The Buyer emotions
•1 The Seller emotions

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294416]
First the buyer's emotions. It is essential that you understand those. **Emotions play a key part in the decision-making process**. Don’t look for facts, look for the emotion behind a motivation. Your understanding of their emotion (your empathy) will give you a lot more credibility.

bit.body: First the buyer's emotions. It is essential that you understand those. **Emotions play a key part in the decision-making process**. Don’t look for facts, look for the emotion behind a motivation. Your understanding of their emotion (your empathy) will give you a lot more credibility.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294417]
The seller's emotions, on the other hand, your emotions, can make or break a deal. Emotions are easily transferred from one person to the other when we are together. You, therefore, don’t want to transfer any negative emotions. Every question, misunderstanding, or objection can cause a negative emotion.

bit.body: The seller's emotions, on the other hand, your emotions, can make or break a deal. Emotions are easily transferred from one person to the other when we are together. You, therefore, don’t want to transfer any negative emotions. Every question, misunderstanding, or objection can cause a negative emotion.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294418]
**The two emotions that you do want to transfer to your prospect are confidence and enthusiasm**.

bit.body: **The two emotions that you do want to transfer to your prospect are confidence and enthusiasm**.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294419]
The person who exerts the greatest amount of emotional control has the highest probability of getting the outcome they desire.

bit.body: The person who exerts the greatest amount of emotional control has the highest probability of getting the outcome they desire.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294420]
Want to learn more about controlling your emotions? The Sensaletion E-Academy dives into this topic and teaches you all about controlling your as well as the customer’s emotions! Find out more!

bit.body: Want to learn more about controlling your emotions? The Sensaletion E-Academy dives into this topic and teaches you all about controlling your as well as the customer’s emotions! Find out more!

bitmark:
[.hint:bitmark++]
[@id:294673]
Ready to join the Sensaletion E-Academy?
==YES READY==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|

bit.body:
Ready to join the Sensaletion E-Academy?
==YES READY==|link:https://www.sensaletion.com/e-academy|

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294421]
[▼ch-14]
[#Every successful seller ...
Has a value statement]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Has a value statement

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294422]
**A value statement is an important first impression** that you give about the value a prospect can expect from you. It’s your solution + result.

bit.body: **A value statement is an important first impression** that you give about the value a prospect can expect from you. It’s your solution + result.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294423]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_7.png][@width:626]

[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:294424]
To create a powerful value statement, you would want to include the following in your statement:

• Effect words:
	• e.g. increase - decrease

• Result words:
	• e.g. market share

• Numbers:
	• e.g. savings

• Relation words:
	• e.g. sharing

• Emotions:
	• e.g. less stress

• Your intangible benefit

bit.body:
To create a powerful value statement, you would want to include the following in your statement:

• Effect words:
	• e.g. increase - decrease

• Result words:
	• e.g. market share

• Numbers:
	• e.g. savings

• Relation words:
	• e.g. sharing

• Emotions:
	• e.g. less stress

• Your intangible benefit

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294425]
[▼ch-15]
[#Every successful seller ...
Adds urgency]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294426]
Are you making it crucial to buy now? **The more urgent, the higher the chance the customer will buy**.

bit.body: Are you making it crucial to buy now? **The more urgent, the higher the chance the customer will buy**.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294427]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_8.png][@width:628]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294428]
Urgency actually belongs to the most influential emotional decision-makers. It is recommended to add urgency in your advertisement, in your micro-commitments, and in your proposal.

bit.body: Urgency actually belongs to the most influential emotional decision-makers. It is recommended to add urgency in your advertisement, in your micro-commitments, and in your proposal.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:294429]
There are several strategies to apply urgency to your offer.

• Numbers
	• We’ve already sold X of this product!
• Deadline
	• Book before date X!
• Scarcity
	• “Only 3 rooms left!” Every hotel website uses this technique.
• Bonus 
	• Book today and get $25,- cashback.

bit.body:
There are several strategies to apply urgency to your offer.

• Numbers
	• We’ve already sold X of this product!
• Deadline
	• Book before date X!
• Scarcity
	• “Only 3 rooms left!” Every hotel website uses this technique.
• Bonus 
	• Book today and get $25,- cashback.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294430]
Incorporate words such as “now, one time only, last chance” in your message.

bit.body: Incorporate words such as “now, one time only, last chance” in your message.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294431]
[▼ch-16]
[#Every successful seller ...
Follows up]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294432]
What’s the purpose of all your effort, all your commitment, if you don’t follow up? You know, the customer expects you to follow up, not them. For both reasons, **you need to follow up**!

bit.body: What’s the purpose of all your effort, all your commitment, if you don’t follow up? You know, the customer expects you to follow up, not them. For both reasons, **you need to follow up**!

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294433]
A follow-up basically takes place after a meeting or a point of contact. It can be a summary of what’s been discussed, it can be an agenda of the next meeting or it can be a simple ‘thank you'.

bit.body: A follow-up basically takes place after a meeting or a point of contact. It can be a summary of what’s been discussed, it can be an agenda of the next meeting or it can be a simple ‘thank you'.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294434]
There are multiple ways to follow up; via email, text, video message, or by phone.

bit.body: There are multiple ways to follow up; via email, text, video message, or by phone.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294435]
It sounds simple, but not following up is a major reason for deals to fail. You lose trust and credibility.

bit.body: It sounds simple, but not following up is a major reason for deals to fail. You lose trust and credibility.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294436]
**Always do as you promise**.

bit.body: **Always do as you promise**.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294437]
[▼ch-17]
[#Every successful seller ...
Knows the objections]

bit.title:
Every successful seller ...
Knows the objections

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294438]
You will face objections, no doubt about it. It’s how you handle them that determines your road to success.

bit.body: You will face objections, no doubt about it. It’s how you handle them that determines your road to success.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294439]
Do you know what’s amazing? **Objections are good.**

bit.body: Do you know what’s amazing? **Objections are good.**

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--&image]
[@id:294440]
[&image:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/sensaletion/sensaletion_free_e_book/web-resources/images/senselation_free_e_book_9.png][@width:578]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294441]
Really? Yes, they are. No deal happens without any form of objection. So an objection actually means that a customer is engaged and interested in working with you.

bit.body: Really? Yes, they are. No deal happens without any form of objection. So an objection actually means that a customer is engaged and interested in working with you.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294442]
**Objections are highly emotional**. You, the seller, must demonstrate a high level of emotional control when faced with an objection. From there, you want to work through them with your buyer.

bit.body: **Objections are highly emotional**. You, the seller, must demonstrate a high level of emotional control when faced with an objection. From there, you want to work through them with your buyer.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:294443]
Not knowing potential objections can set you off, surprise you and likely disable you to control your emotions. When you are aware of potential objections, you can prepare, control your emotions and show your expertise while solving them.

bit.body: Not knowing potential objections can set you off, surprise you and likely disable you to control your emotions. When you are aware of potential objections, you can prepare, control your emotions and show your expertise while solving them.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:294444]
[▼ch-18]
[#16 successful strategies 
that highly increase your chances of closing deals.]

bit.title:
16 successful strategies 
that highly increase your chances of closing deals.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:294445]
However, there is still so much more to learn!

• Do you want to learn **how to construct an effective sales system** for yourself? You will build your own sales system with the Sensaletion E-Academy.

• Do you know your intangible value? The E-Academy exercises help you to **discover your intangible value**!

• Do you want to learn **how to establish your own credibility**? The Sensaletion E-Academy teaches all the techniques to ensure you win your prospects’ credibility!

• Would you love to get examples of a great pipeline? One of the handouts to download in the Sensaletion E-Academy is a **pipeline example** that is ready  be used by you!

• There are many different forms of objections and each form comes with a different approach to how to handle the situation. In the Sensaletion E-Academy, **an entire episode is dedicated to the matter of objections**. You’ll learn which objections exist, when to expect them and how to overcome them.

bit.body:

• Would you love to get examples of a great pipeline? One of the handouts to download in the Sensaletion E-Academy is a **pipeline example** that is ready  be used by you!

• There are many different forms of objections and each form comes with a different approach to how to handle the situation. In the Sensaletion E-Academy, **an entire episode is dedicated to the matter of objections**. You’ll learn which objections exist, when to expect them and how to overcome them.
